scenarios.name: Rotary Kiln Bearing Overheating
scenarios.failure_description: The rotary kiln support roller bearing temperature increased from normal 65°C to 95°C over 2 hours. Kiln was shut down as a precaution when temperature reached 100°C alarm setpoint.
relevant_pdfs: Rotary kiln and Annular cooler lubrication_Hongda_OEM Manual.pdf

scenarios.name: ID&HR Fan Motor Overcurrent Trip
scenarios.failure_description: The induced draft fan motor tripped on overcurrent protection. Motor current was observed at 420A against rated 380A before trip. Fan was running normally before the incident.
symptoms: System draft pressure higher than normal
scenarios.expected_root_cause: Excessive system resistance or damper malfunction

scenarios.name: Burner Flame Instability
scenarios.failure_description: The kiln burner flame became unstable with frequent flame detector alarms. Flame appeared yellow and smoky instead of the normal blue flame. Coal feed rate and air flow were at normal setpoints.
symptoms: Yellow smoky flame instead of blue
Secondary air temperature lower than normal
scenarios.expected_root_cause: Poor combustion air-fuel ratio or burner nozzle blockage

scenarios.name: Bucket Elevator Chain Breakage
scenarios.failure_description: The bucket elevator chain broke during operation, causing material spillage and emergency shutdown. The chain had been in service for 18 months. Recent maintenance records show chain tension was adjusted 2 weeks ago.
symptoms: Chain found broken at one link
scenarios.expected_root_cause: Chain fatigue, overloading, or improper tension adjustment

scenarios.name: ESP High Emission Levels
scenarios.failure_description: Stack emission levels increased from normal 30 mg/Nm³ to 120 mg/Nm³. ESP secondary voltage and current readings are normal. Rapping system is operating as per schedule.
scenarios.expected_root_cause: Electrode misalignment, gas distribution issue, or insulator contamination
